sections.title: Executive Summary Structure
sections.description: Writing summaries that busy executives will actually read

principles.name: The Inverted Pyramid
principles.description: Lead with conclusions and recommendations, then supporting details
principles.example: Recommendation: Approve the $2M digital transformation initiative. This investment will generate $8M in efficiency gains over three years while reducing operational risk.

principles.name: Quantify Impact
principles.description: Use numbers to make abstract concepts concrete
principles.strong: This will reduce processing time by 40%, saving 200 staff hours per month.

principles.name: Action-Oriented Language
principles.description: Clearly state what decision or action is needed
principles.weak: The committee should consider whether to proceed.
principles.strong: The committee is asked to approve Phase 1 funding by March 15.

components.content: Key findings, recommendations, and requested decisions
Why this report exists, what problem it addresses
How data was gathered and analyzed
What the analysis revealed, organized by theme
Specific actions with rationale and expected outcomes
Supporting data, detailed methodology, supplementary analysis

guidelines.poor: Your department failed to meet targets.
guidelines.improved: Q3 results fell 15% below target, primarily due to supply chain delays.

guidelines.passive: Mistakes were made in the process.
guidelines.active: The project team identified three process errors.

guidelines.principle: Avoid hedge words when certainty exists
guidelines.hedged: It seems like we might possibly need additional resources.
guidelines.direct: The project requires two additional engineers.

writingTask.title: Market Expansion Executive Summary
writingTask.prompt: Write an executive summary (200-250 words) recommending whether your company should expand into the Southeast Asian market. Include: a clear recommendation, 2-3 supporting reasons with data, potential risks, and requested decision.
writingTask.sampleResponse:
Executive Summary: Southeast Asian Market Expansion

Recommendation: Proceed with market entry in Vietnam and Thailand in Q3, with Indonesia to follow in Q1 of the next fiscal year.

Rationale:
The Southeast Asian market presents a compelling growth opportunity with acceptable risk levels.

1. Market Size: The target region represents 680 million consumers with a growing middle class projected to reach 350 million by 2030. Our product category is growing at 18% annually in these markets.

2. Competitive Positioning: Only two major competitors have established presence. Early entry gives us 18-24 months' first-mover advantage in Vietnam.

3. Cost Structure: Operating costs are 40% lower than our current markets, with access to a skilled workforce graduating 500,000 engineers annually.

Risks and Mitigation:
- Regulatory complexity: We recommend partnering with local distributors initially (reducing upfront investment by 60%)
- Currency volatility: Treasury has identified hedging strategies to limit exposure
- Cultural adaptation: Market research budget of $200K allocated for localization

Investment Required: $3.5M over 18 months
Projected ROI: 180% by Year 3, breakeven at Month 18

Decision Requested: Approve Phase 1 funding ($1.2M) to establish Vietnam operations by end of Q2. Full business case in Appendix A.
